<code>abbr</code>: Abbreviates the text. Only the first character and subsequent characters following white space will be included.
<code>acronym</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
liststring'acronyms'

Does an acronym lookup for the text. You can optionally pass the name of the list; the list must live in the Zotero/better-bibtex directory in your profile, and must use commas as the delimiter.
<code>alphanum</code>: clears out everything but unicode alphanumeric characters (unicode character classes L and N)
<code>capitalize</code>: uppercases the first letter of each word
<code>clean</code>: transliterates the citation key and removes unsafe characters
<code>condense</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
sepstring''

this replaces spaces in the value passed in. You can specify what to replace it with by adding it as a parameter, e.g .condense(_) will replace spaces with underscores. Parameter should not contain spaces unless you want the spaces in the value passed in to be replaced with those spaces in the parameter
<code>default</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
textstring

Returns the given text if no output was generated
<code>fold</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
modechinese / german / japanese

tries to replace diacritics with ascii look-alikes. Removes non-ascii characters it cannot match
<code>formatDate</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
formatstring'%Y-%m-%d'

formats date as by replacing y, m and d in the format
<code>jieba</code>: word segmentation for Chinese items. Uses substantial memory; must be enabled under Preferences -> Better BibTeX -> Advanced -> Citekeys
<code>kuromoji</code>: word segmentation for Japanese items. Uses substantial memory; must be enabled under Preferences -> Better BibTeX -> Advanced -> Citekeys
<code>len</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
relation!= / < / <= / = / > / >='>'
lengthnumber0

If the length of the output does not match the given number, skip to the next pattern.
<code>localTime</code>: transforms date/time to local time. Mainly useful for dateAdded and dateModified as it requires an ISO-formatted input.
<code>lower</code>: Forces the text inserted by the field marker to be in lowercase. For example, auth.lower expands to the last name of the first author in lowercase.
<code>match</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
matchRegExp / string

If the length of the output does not match the given number, skip to the next pattern.
<code>nopunctordash</code>: Removes punctuation and word-connecting dashes. alias for nopunct(dash='')
<code>numeric</code>: returns the value if it's an integer
<code>postfix</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
postfixstring

postfixes with its parameter, so postfix(_) will add an underscore to the end if, and only if, the value it is supposed to postfix isn't empty
<code>prefix</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
prefixstring

prefixes with its parameter, so .prefix(_) will add an underscore to the front if, and only if, the value it is supposed to prefix isn't empty.
<code>replace</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
findstring / RegExp
replacestring

replaces text, case insensitive when passing a string; .replace('.etal','&etal') will replace .EtAl with &etal
<code>select</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
startnumber1
nnumber

selects words from the value passed in. The format is select(start,number) (1-based), so select(1,4) or select(n=4) would select the first four words. If n is not given, all words from start to the end are selected.
<code>skipwords</code>:
filters out common words like 'of', 'the', â€¦ the list of words can be seen and changed by going into about:config under the key extensions.zotero.translators.better-bibtex.skipWords as a comma-separated, case-insensitive list of words.

If you want to strip words like 'Jr.' from names, you could use something like [Auth:nopunct:skipwords:fold] after adding jr to the skipWords list. Note that this filter is always applied if you use title (which is different from Title) or shorttitle.
<code>substring</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
startnumber1
nnumber

substring(start,n) selects n (default: all) characters starting at start (default: 1)
<code>transliterate</code>:
parameters:
parametertypedefault
modechinese / de / german / ja / japanese / minimal / zh

transliterates the citation key. If you don't specify a mode, the mode is derived from the item language field
<code>upper</code>: Forces the text inserted by the field marker to be in uppercase. For example, [auth:upper] expands the last name of the first author in uppercase.
